page.title: 13John's Day, Newcastle
page.content: John, 10, goes to school in{Jesmond, {Newcastle. } On Sundays, I usually wake up by 8.20, then read while I wait for the papers to be delivered. Later, after breakfast, I get ready for church. I go to St. Mary's Cathedral which has beautifully coloured stained glass windows. On returning home we all play croquet on my big lawn or I build Lego models. Then I practice the piano for 35 minutes. We usually have a traditional Sunday lunch of roast, potatoes, and vegetables from my Dad's greenhouse. However, sometimes we picnic out in the picturesque Northumbrian countryside. After lunch I listen to music,paint, draw or play games with my brother. I find Sundays very restful after a week of hard work at school.
